subject_terms_3: Force 136 (Guerilla movement) 1942-1945 Japanese occupation Chin, Phui Kong, 1923- war personalities
physical_appearance: This is a brown canvas bag. It is rectangular in shape, with a flap across the top and two fastening buckles in front. The bag has a single long strap attached to the sides. It is slightly stained. There are no inscriptions seen on the bag.
sgcool_label_text:
This bag belongs to part of a collection of artefacts owned by Chan Phui Kong ???and related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. Chanâ€™s collection forms part of a larger collection of materials gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012), who was a fellow and key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee, which date from the late 1980s to early 2000s. 

Force 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya.
title_text: Chan Phui Kong Collection: Canvas bag
